Moving from the operating plan obligation to the licensing phase means that a longer period is available for municipalities and promoters of building plan developments to reach agreements on the development of a location through the (anterior) agreement, including related agreements on cost recovery. It is indicated that this decision is taken first during the licensing phase, in the situation that the municipality will then be confronted with an application for an environmental permit for construction where the cost recovery is not otherwise insured (by municipal land issue or an anterior agreement). If it appears that the cost recovery is not otherwise insured prior to the permit application (e.g. through the conclusion of an anterior agreement on land operation or through municipal land issuance), and the application of the operating plan obligation leads to an operating design involving a deficit not covered by the municipality, this gives to the competent authority (mayor and aldermen)
